| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2449](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2449 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c")                         |

- *For the monster in xNetHack, see [black mold (xNetHack)](/index.php?title=Black_mold_\(xNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black mold (xNetHack) (page does not exist)").*

A **black mold**, F, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The black mold is a type of [mold](/wiki/Mold "Mold") that is [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile") and lacks limbs, eyes or a head like other molds, and has a 9⁄10 chance of [reviving](/wiki/Reviving "Reviving") from its [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") if they leave one behind.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Black molds have a [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that has a 2⁄3 chance of triggering in response to a melee attack that does not kill them, as well as a second passive attack that deals [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage: due to how passive attacks function in *NetHack*, only the first passive attack is used.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) The poisonous passive attack is harmless if the attacker has [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), is [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") or is being [strangled](/wiki/Strangulation "Strangulation")[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) - otherwise, the attacker takes damage with a 4⁄5 chance of an additional 6-15 damage, a 1⁄6 chance of losing 3-5 points of [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), and a 1⁄30 chance of [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath"). Black molds possess poison resistance, and in Hack'EM they also possess [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance").

A black mold [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 2⁄5 chance (40%) of granting poison resistance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Messages](#Messages)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Black molds are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and are always created hostile.

A black mold has an overall 7.4% chance of generating from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic"), and is not located within or on top of a square of [water](/wiki/Water "Water"), [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## Strategy

Black molds are fairly dangerous to attack in melee: despite being flagged as appearing only in Gehennom, generation mechanics for fungi mean that they can be found growing on corpses as early as the first level of the dungeon. A [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s starting [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") will need to reach [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") 5 to even attack one in most of these cases, and most of them cannot safely attack the mold without being poisoned in return, with the only exception being the [Necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer")'s [ghoul](/wiki/Ghoul "Ghoul").

Fortunately, the sessile black molds are as vulnerable to all forms of [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") as any other mold, and can otherwise be safely ignored unless they are blocking a [door](/wiki/Door "Door") or other path that the hero wishes to explore; they are no danger by the time a hero reaches Gehennom. Despite their poisonous and acidic passives, black molds are neither acidic nor poisonous to eat, and can be a useful early source of poison resistance.

## Messages

- You inhale a cloud of spores!

  You attacked a disgusting mold in melee.

- A cloud of spores surrounds you!

  As above, but you are breathless or being strangled.

## Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified  
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.  
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.  
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)  
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

\[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

## References

Black mold (SLASH'EM)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
F black mold
Difficulty 8
Attacks Passive 0d4 poison, Passive 1d8 acid
F black mold
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Passive 0d4 poison, Passive 1d8 acid

Base level 6
Base experience 85
Speed 0
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Small
Resistances poison, acid (Hack'EM only)
Resistances conveyed poison (40%)

A black mold:

  • does not breathe.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2449
For the monster in xNetHack, see black mold (xNetHack).

A black mold, F, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM. The black mold is a type of mold that is sessile and lacks limbs, eyes or a head like other molds, and has a 9⁄10 chance of reviving from its corpse if they leave one behind.[1]

Black molds have a poisonous passive attack that has a 2⁄3 chance of triggering in response to a melee attack that does not kill them, as well as a second passive attack that deals acid damage: due to how passive attacks function in NetHack, only the first passive attack is used.[2] The poisonous passive attack is harmless if the attacker has poison resistance, is unbreathing or is being strangled[3][4] - otherwise, the attacker takes damage with a 4⁄5 chance of an additional 6-15 damage, a 1⁄6 chance of losing 3-5 points of strength, and a 1⁄30 chance of instadeath. Black molds possess poison resistance, and in Hack'EM they also possess acid resistance.

A black mold corpse or tin has a 2⁄5 chance (40%) of granting poison resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Generation

Black molds are only randomly generated in Gehennom, and are always created hostile.

A black mold has an overall 7.4% chance of generating from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not acidic, and is not located within or on top of a square of water, ice or lava.[5][6][7][8]

Strategy

Black molds are fairly dangerous to attack in melee: despite being flagged as appearing only in Gehennom, generation mechanics for fungi mean that they can be found growing on corpses as early as the first level of the dungeon. A hero's starting pet will need to reach level 5 to even attack one in most of these cases, and most of them cannot safely attack the mold without being poisoned in return, with the only exception being the Necromancer's ghoul.

Fortunately, the sessile black molds are as vulnerable to all forms of ranged attacks as any other mold, and can otherwise be safely ignored unless they are blocking a door or other path that the hero wishes to explore; they are no danger by the time a hero reaches Gehennom. Despite their poisonous and acidic passives, black molds are neither acidic nor poisonous to eat, and can be a useful early source of poison resistance.

Messages

You inhale a cloud of spores!
You attacked a disgusting mold in melee.
A cloud of spores surrounds you!
As above, but you are breathless or being strangled.

Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

{{for|the monster in xNetHack|black mold (xNetHack)}}
A '''black mold''', {{monsym|black mold}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]] and [[SlashTHEM]], and [[Hack'EM]]. The black mold is a type of [[mold]] that is [[sessile]] and lacks limbs, eyes or a head like other molds, and has a {{frac|9|10}} chance of [[reviving]] from its [[corpse]] if they leave one behind.{{refsrc|mkobj.c|764|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Black molds have a [[poisonous]] [[passive attack]] that has a {{frac|2|3}} chance of triggering in response to a melee attack that does not kill them, as well as a second passive attack that deals [[acid]] damage: due to how passive attacks function in ''NetHack'', only the first passive attack is used.{{refsrc|uhitm.c|3033|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} The poisonous passive attack is harmless if the attacker has [[poison resistance]], is [[unbreathing]] or is being [[Strangulation|strangled]]{{refsrc|uhitm.c|3134|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|uhitm.c|3137|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} - otherwise, the attacker takes damage with a {{frac|4|5}} chance of an additional 6-15 damage, a {{frac|6}} chance of losing 3-5 points of [[strength]], and a {{frac|30}} chance of [[instadeath]]. Black molds possess poison resistance, and in Hack'EM they also possess [[acid resistance]].

A black mold [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|2|5}} chance (40%) of granting poison resistance.

==Generation==
Black molds are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], and are always created hostile.

A black mold has an overall 7.4% chance of generating from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not [[acidic]], and is not located within or on top of a square of [[water]], [[ice]] or [[lava]].{{refsrc|mkobj.c|765|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|do.c|1685|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|mkobj.c|811|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|do.c|1680|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

==Strategy==
Black molds are fairly dangerous to attack in melee: despite being flagged as appearing only in Gehennom, generation mechanics for fungi mean that they can be found growing on corpses as early as the first level of the dungeon. A [[hero]]'s starting [[pet]] will need to reach [[Monster level|level]] 5 to even attack one in most of these cases, and most of them cannot safely attack the mold without being poisoned in return, with the only exception being the [[Necromancer]]'s [[ghoul]].

Fortunately, the sessile black molds are as vulnerable to all forms of [[ranged attack]]s as any other mold, and can otherwise be safely ignored unless they are blocking a [[door]] or other path that the hero wishes to explore; they are no danger by the time a hero reaches Gehennom. Despite their poisonous and acidic passives, black molds are neither acidic nor poisonous to eat, and can be a useful early source of poison resistance.

{{message|A cloud of spores surrounds you!|As above, but you are breathless or being strangled.}}
